article:
I always thought there was nothing exciting in my life. The furniture  in my house was _ . And I didn't have money to change it. But two poor children changed my _ .
The two children were outside my door one day. Their clothes were _ . "Do you have any old papers, lady?" they asked.
I wanted to say _ --- until I looked down at their _ . They didn't wear shoes.
"Come in and I'll make you a cup of juice." I said. They came with dirty footprints  on the floor.
I gave them some juice. They _ it and the girl held the empty  cup in her hands, looking at it. The boy asked, "Lady, are you rich?"
"Am I rich? No!" I said in surprise .
The girl put her cup back in its saucer  _ . "Your cups match your saucers," he said. Then the two children left without saying "Thank you". In fact, they didn't need to. They did more than saying that. My cups and saucers were very common , _ they matched.
I looked at the house again. All the things _ nicer to me. The furniture was old, but one piece matches the other.
The dirty footprints were still on my floor. They made me never forget how rich I am.
